question: 9. What is an array in c?

answer.content: A. It is a homogeneous data structure which can hold data of same type
B. It is a homogeneous data structure which can hold data of different type
C. It is a heterogeneous data structure which can hold data of same type

question: 10. What is a structure in c?

answer.content: A. It is a user defined data type which can hold the data of heterogeneous type
B. It is a homogeneous data structure which can hold data of different type
C. It is a heterogeneous data structure which can hold data of same type

question: 11. What is the termination character for char array or strings in c?
12. What is the difference between structure and union in c?

answer.content: A. In structure, memory is allocated for all variables. Where as in union memory is allocated for only one variable which requires more memory. (i.e for higher data type variable).
B. Structure and union both allocates memory for all variables

question: 13. What is a pointer in c?

answer.content: A. Pointer is a variable which holds the address of anything.
B. There are no pointers in c
D. Compile time error, lvalue required

question: 16. Can a function return multiple values in C program?

answer.content: C. Yes, but by returning structures or arrays or unions or other data structures

question: 17. If a function is called by passing a value, and if the called function has changed the value passed, then will it have any effect on calling function's value?

answer.content: A. No, pass by value will not have any effect.
B. Yes, pass by value will have effect if called functions changes the value passed to it.
